snippet: The accident, near Bordeaux, was the country’s deadliest in 33 years, officials said. Most of the victims were retirees on an excursion that included a ham-tasting.

byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Béziers, France; Elian Peltier from Paris; and Hannah Olivennes from London.
byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and LILIA BLAISE

abstract: French officials say at least 43 people have died and eight have been injured in head-on collision between bus full of elderly sightseers and truck, worst traffic accident in country in 33 years.
lead_paragraph: The accident, near Bordeaux, was the country’s deadliest in 33 years, officials said. Most of the victims were retirees on an excursion that included a ham-tasting.

headline.print_headline: 43 Die in France as Bus and Truck Hit Head-On
headline.main: 43 Killed in Southwestern France as Bus and Truck Collide
